class_notes: **2nd Half of the Semester: Oct. 19th - Dec. 6th
course_description: Prerequisites: BIOS 500, BIOS 501, or BIOS 506 or permission of the instructor. This course is an introduction to the field of Bioinformatics for students with a quantitative background. The course covers biological sequence analysis, introductions to genomics, transcriptomics, proteomics and metabolomics, as well as some basic data analysis methods associated with the high-throughput data. In addition, the course introduces concepts such as curse of dimensionality, multiple testing and false discovery rate, and basic concepts of networks.
sections: Class Nbr: 3133, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 3-4:50p, Instructor: Qin/Yu, Status: Open
